form.official-title: To amend the Small Business Act with respect to the procurement program for women-owned small business concerns, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Women’s Procurement Program Equalization Act of 2013.
Section 8(m) of the Small Business Act (15 U.S.C. 637(m)) is amended—

paragraph.text: in paragraph (2), so that subparagraph (E) reads as follows:

clause.text: is certified by a Federal agency, a State government, or a national certifying entity approved by the Administrator, as a small business concern owned and controlled by women; or
is certified by the Administrator as a small business concern owned and controlled by women.

paragraph.text: by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.header: Sole source contracts for economically disadvantaged women-owned small businesses
paragraph.text: In accordance with this section, a contracting officer may award a sole source contract to any small business concern meeting the requirements of section 8(m)(2)(A) of this Act if—

subparagraph.text: such concern is determined to be a responsible contract with respect to performance of such contract opportunity and the contracting officer does not have a reasonable expectation that 2 or more businesses meeting the requirements of section 8(m)(2)(A) will submit offers;
the anticipated award price of the contract (including options) will not exceed—

clause.text: $6,500,000 in the case of a contract opportunity assigned a standard industrial code for manufacturing; or
$4,000,000 in the case of any other contract opportunity; and

subparagraph.text: in the estimation of the contracting officer, the contract award can be made at a fair and reasonable price.

paragraph.header: Sole source contracts for women owned small businesses in substantially underrepresented industries
paragraph.text: In accordance with this section, a contracting officer may award a sole source contract to any small business concerns meeting the requirements of section 8(m)(3) of this Act if—

subparagraph.text: such concern is determined to be a responsible contract with respect to performance of such contract opportunity and the contracting officer does not have a reasonable expectation that 2 or more businesses meeting the requirements of section 8(m)(3) will submit offers;
the anticipated award price of the contract (including options) will not exceed—

clause.text: $6,500,000 in the case of a contract opportunity assigned a standard industrial code for manufacturing; or
$4,000,000 in the case of any other contract opportunity; and

subparagraph.text: in the estimation of the contracting officer, the contract award can be made at a fair and reasonable price.

section.header: Reporting on goals for procurement contracts awarded to small business concerns
section.text: Section 15(h)(2)(E)(viii) of the Small Business Act (15 U.S.C. 644) is amended to read as follows:

clause.text: small business concerns owned and controlled by women—

subclause.text: through competitions restricted to small business concerns;
through competitions restricted using the authority under section 8(m)(2);
through competitions restricted using the authority under section 8(m)(2) and in which the waiver authority under section 8(m)(3) was used;
through sole source contracts awarded using the authority under section 8(m)(7);
through sole source contracts awarded using the authority under section 8(m)(8) and in which the waiver authority under section 8(m)(3) was used;
by industry in which the contracts described in subclauses (III) through (VI) were awarded; and
